metadata.title: CVE-2016-6131 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
The demangler in GNU Libiberty allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (infinite loop, stack overflow, and crash) via a cycle in thereferences of remembered mangled types.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6131` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

valgrind - 1:3.12.0-1.1ubuntu1
valgrind-mpi - 1:3.12.0-1.1ubuntu1
No subscription required

ht - 2.1.0+repack1-1
No subscription required

gdb - 7.99.90.20170502-0ubuntu1
gdb-multiarch - 7.99.90.20170502-0ubuntu1
gdb-source - 7.99.90.20170502-0ubuntu1
gdb64 - 7.99.90.20170502-0ubuntu1
gdbserver - 7.99.90.20170502-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

binutils - 2.28-3ubuntu1
binutils-aarch64-linux-gnu - 2.28-3ubuntu1
binutils-alpha-linux-gnu - 2.28-3ubuntu1

binutils-mips64el-linux-gnuabin32 - 2.28-3ubuntu1
binutils-mipsel-linux-gnu - 2.28-3ubuntu1
binutils-multiarch - 2.28-3ubuntu1
binutils-powerpc-linux-gnu - 2.28-3ubuntu1
binutils-powerpc-linux-gnuspe - 2.28-3ubuntu1
binutils-powerpc64-linux-gnu - 2.28-3ubuntu1
binutils-powerpc64le-linux-gnu - 2.28-3ubuntu1
binutils-s390x-linux-gnu - 2.28-3ubuntu1

criterions.comment: valgrind package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:3.12.0-1.1ubuntu1').
ht package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.0+repack1-1').
gcc-h8300-hms package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and needs fixing.
gdb package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.99.90.20170502-0ubuntu1').
binutils-h8300-hms package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and needs fixing.
nescc package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and needs fixing.
binutils package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.28-3ubuntu1').
